project.description: create Ami from Ova: 1. download from artifactory 2 OVA Files 2.copy both ova to S3 Bucket (arm-ova2ami) 3. import both OVA files to AMI (ARM_Configurator,arm_Router) 4.share both AMIs to QA

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#copy files 2 OVA FIles to S3 bucket aws s3 cp ovaFiles/com/ac/arm/OVA/${TAG}/ARM-Conf_${TAG}/ARM-Conf_${TAG}.ova s3://arm-ova2ami/${TAG}/ aws s3 cp ovaFiles/com/ac/arm/OVA/${TAG}/ARM-Router_${TAG}/ARM-Router_${TAG}.ova s3://arm-ova2ami/${TAG}/
#configutration to import both OVA Files to S3 bucket cat << EOF > containers_Conf.json [ { "Description": "ARM Configurator ${TAG} OVA", "Format": "ova", "UserBucket": { "S3Bucket": "arm-ova2ami", "S3Key": "${TAG}/ARM-Conf_${TAG}.ova" } }] EOF
cat << EOF > containers_Router.json [ { "Description": "ARM Router ${TAG} OVA", "Format": "ova", "UserBucket": { "S3Bucket": "arm-ova2ami", "S3Key": "${TAG}/ARM-Router_${TAG}.ova" } }] EOF #import OVA 2 AMI ImportTaskId_Conf=$(aws ec2 import-image --description "ARM Configurator ${TAG} OVA" --license-type BYOL --disk-containers file://containers_Conf.json) echo $ImportTaskId_Conf ImportTaskId_Conf=$(echo $ImportTaskId_Conf | cut -d' ' -f5) echo $ImportTaskId_Conf ImportTaskId_Router=$(aws ec2 import-image --description "ARM Router ${TAG} OVA" --license-type BYOL --disk-containers file://containers_Router.json) echo $ImportTaskId_Router ImportTaskId_Router=$(echo $ImportTaskId_Router | cut -d' ' -f5) echo $ImportTaskId_Router
conf_status_ret=1 router_status_ret=1 #if return value in while is 1 =>dont fail the build (true not good in this case) set +e while [[ "$conf_status_ret" != "0" ]] && [[ "$router_status_ret" != "0" ]] do echo "importing both OVA files to AMI" sleep 100 #check if complete create AMI
conf_status=$(aws ec2 describe-import-image-tasks --import-task-ids ${ImportTaskId_Conf} | grep IMPORTIMAGETASKS | grep completed) conf_status_ret=$? router_status=$(aws ec2 describe-import-image-tasks --import-task-ids ${ImportTaskId_Router}| grep IMPORTIMAGETASKS | grep completed) router_status_ret=$? done set -e echo "finish importing both OVA Files to AMI" confAmi=($(aws ec2 describe-import-image-tasks --import-task-ids ${ImportTaskId_Conf})) confAmi=${confAmi[6]} routerAmi=($(aws ec2 describe-import-image-tasks --import-task-ids ${ImportTaskId_Router})) routerAmi=${routerAmi[6]} #get Snapshot id - we need it in order to tag the snapshot as well confSnapshotId=$(aws ec2 describe-images --image-ids $confAmi --output text --query Images[*].BlockDeviceMappings[*].Ebs.SnapshotId) routerSnapshotId=$(aws ec2 describe-images --image-ids $routerAmi --output text --query Images[*].BlockDeviceMappings[*].Ebs.SnapshotId) #give name to the AMI aws ec2 create-tags --resources $confAmi --tags Key=Name,Value="ARM-ConfiguratorAMI_${TAG}" aws ec2 create-tags --resources $routerAmi --tags Key=Name,Value="ARM-RouterAMI_${TAG}" #give name to the snapshot aws ec2 create-tags --resources $confSnapshotId --tags Key=Name,Value="ARM-ConfiguratorAMI_${TAG}" aws ec2 create-tags --resources $routerSnapshotId --tags Key=Name,Value="ARM-RouterAMI_${TAG}" #give permissions to QA #qaAccount="" #give permissions to ovoc QA Account to the AMI #aws ec2 modify-image-attribute --image-id $confAmi --launch-permission "{\"Add\":[{\"UserId\":\"$qaAccount\"}]}" #aws ec2 modify-image-attribute --image-id $routerAmi --launch-permission "{\"Add\":[{\"UserId\":\"$qaAccount\"}]}"
